lines.text: You're just about the most attractive girl I've ever met
Very good. Kinda sterotyped, but still effective. Time out while I work up a maidenly blush.
Now this is your last chance. I'm not going to ask you this question any more. How about having dinner with me some night?
Love to.
When?
Oh, sometime in the distant future... say, um, tonight.
Perfect. Where would you like to go, the Casino?
Oh, let's not and say we did. Those upper-crust places make me jitter.
Well, how about Thompson's Lunch?
actors, gamblers, thieves, bootleggers, ladies and...and women. That's my dish.
Must a man be an artist to interst you?

the look in his eye, the feel of his hands. You haven't a mark on you, Dirk, not a mark. You gave up being an architect because it was an uphill, disheartening job at the time. I don't say you should have kept on. For all I know, you were a terrible architect. But if you had kept on, if you'd loved it enough to keep on fighting and struggling, why that fight would show in your face today--in your eyes, in your whole being.
In the name of Heaven, Dallas, I have...
I'm not criticizing you, but...but you're all smooth. And I like 'em bumpy.
no matter what happens - good or bad - it's just so much velvet.
You know, you seem like much too nice a fellow to sit behind a desk, pushing buttons.
I haven't been a high-powered executive for long. I used to be an architect.
Why did you give it up?
Oh, nothing in it...
What do you mean, "Nothing in it"?
No money!
Who cares!... Gee, I'd rather plan the back door of a beautiful building, than sell all the bonds ever engraved.
Listen, Dallas, what do you think of me, anyway?

[Indifferently]
You're a nice young man.

[Somewhat deflated]
Oh, well that's like telling a fella' he "means well."
Sorry, but you asked for it.
Fields of cabbages just like you said, they are beautiful!
Ha-ha-ha... Selina, aren't we funny looking?
I know I am. And, Julie Hempel, the size of your bustle!
You know, the bustle did hide a multitude of sins!
The collection this Sabbath morning, is for our foreign missions among the ignorant heathen in China.
Mrs. De Jong, the Hay Market is no place for a decent woman. There's drinking, card-playing, all manner of wickedness, daughters of Jezebel on the street going among the wagons.
Really!
